dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.welcome: Welcome to RAG Platform - Intelligent Retrieval Augmented Generation Platform!
dashboard.description: The system is running well. You can access various functional modules through the left navigation bar:

features.knowledgeBase: Knowledge Bases: Manage your knowledge bases, create, delete and configure knowledge bases
features.documents: Document Management: Upload, process and manage documents, supporting multiple formats
features.chat: Intelligent Chat: Conduct intelligent Q&A with AI based on knowledge bases
features.settings: System Settings: Configure model parameters and system options

createDialog.title: Create New Knowledge Base
createDialog.nameInvalidError: Only letters, numbers, and underscores are allowed
createDialog.nameHint: Only letters, numbers, and underscores are allowed. Spaces and hyphens will be converted to underscores automatically.

empty.title: No knowledge bases created yet
empty.description: Click "Create Knowledge Base" button to start building your first knowledge base

semanticLayer.title: Semantic Layer / Ontology
semanticLayer.description: Automatically discover candidate entities, relations, and attributes. After human review, they become part of the ontology for better retrieval and analysis.

graph.title: Candidate relation graph
graph.description: Visualize entities, relations, and attributes from the current filters.
graph.labelAuto: Auto (hide relation labels on large graphs)

empty.title: No candidates yet
empty.description: Click “Auto discovery” to generate candidates, then review and merge them here.

list.empty: No candidates yet. Run auto discovery first.

details.title: Candidate details
details.empty: Select a candidate to view evidence and suggested relations.

conflicts.entityExists: An entity or alias with the same name already exists.
conflicts.relationExists: This relation already exists in the ontology.
conflicts.aliasSame: Candidate name matches the target entity; alias will be skipped.
conflicts.aliasExists: Candidate name already exists as an alias; alias will be skipped.
conflicts.targetMissing: Target entity not found; a new entity will be created.
conflicts.nameCollision: Target name already exists and may cause a collision.

merge.title: Merge candidate
merge.helper: Enter the target or new entity name.
merge.note: This will write the merge decision and mark the candidate as approved.

semanticLayer.previewNotice: Preview data only. Backend integration will replace these candidates.

progress.backgroundNote: Runs in the background. You can leave this page and check progress later.

ontology.title: Ontology Management
ontology.description: Generate and maintain ontology constraints for structured extraction.

cards.rulesActive: Hard constraints are enabled and will limit extraction.
cards.rulesInactive: Hard constraints are not enabled; extraction is more open.
cards.structureHint: Section titles become structure nodes; keep it lean but precise.

dialog.title: Ontology Draft Review
dialog.aliasesHint: Separate multiple aliases with commas or semicolons
dialog.constraintsHint: Enter a JSON object, e.g. {"required": true}
dialog.invalidJson: Constraints must be valid JSON object

publishDialog.title: Publish ontology
publishDialog.description: Publishing enables hard constraints for downstream extraction and filtering.

discoveryDialog.title: Auto discovery
discoveryDialog.documentSelectHelp: Search and select multiple documents; leave empty to use scope
discoveryDialog.documentSelectSingleHelp: Select exactly one document for insights
discoveryDialog.maxChunksHelper: 1-50, default 3 (ignored when full scan is on)
discoveryDialog.batchSizeHelper: Chunks per request (1-6). Larger is faster
discoveryDialog.entityTypesHelper: Comma or newline separated; leave blank for all
discoveryDialog.relationTypesHelper: Comma or newline separated; leave blank for all

settings.title: Knowledge Base Settings
settings.retrievalTopKHelp: Number of chunks returned per retrieval
settings.fetchError: Failed to load knowledge base settings
settings.updateError: Failed to update knowledge base settings

messages.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this knowledge base? This action cannot be undone.

chat.title: Intelligent Chat
chat.welcome: Hello! I'm the intelligent assistant of RAG Platform. You can choose knowledge bases for document-based Q&A, or chat directly without knowledge bases.
chat.selectKnowledgeBaseFirst: Please select a knowledge base first
chat.errorResponse: Sorry, I cannot answer your question at the moment. Please try again later.
chat.timeoutWithKnowledgeBase: Request timed out. Try again or switch to Normal Chat.

systemPrompt.title: System Prompt
systemPrompt.label: System Prompt
systemPrompt.placeholder: Optional instructions for the assistant. You can use {context} and {query} as placeholders for RAG.
systemPrompt.helper: If you include {context} or {query}, the prompt will be used as a full template.

documents.title: Document Management
documents.comingSoon: Document management feature is under development
documents.description: This feature will support document upload, processing and management

empty.createFirst: Create a knowledge base before uploading or managing documents.

file.supportedFormats: Supports PDF, DOCX, TXT, MD, HTML, CSV, JSON, XML, RTF, EPUB, ODT, Excel, PowerPoint and more

duplicatePolicy.label: Duplicate Handling
duplicatePolicy.help: Controls what happens when uploading files with the same name or content.

preview.hint: Uses the first selected file; showing first {{count}} chunks
preview.title: Chunk Preview

help.title: Upload Help
help.chunkingDesc: After upload, documents are split into chunks using the selected strategy for retrieval and Q&A.
help.tip: If unsure, keep the default. You can reprocess documents later in the knowledge base.
help.embeddingHint: Tip: some embedding models limit single input length (e.g. ≤ 512 tokens). The system will split over-limit chunks, but consider reducing chunk size to lower cost.

confirm.clearVectors: Clear all vectors in this knowledge base? This cannot be undone.
confirm.semanticCleanup: This will remove semantic evidence that references deleted documents. Continue?

messages.semanticCleanupSuccess: Removed {{removed}} evidence entries and deleted {{deleted}} candidates.

tooltips.retryOnlyFailed: Only failed documents can be retried

errorHints.embeddingTokenLimit: The embedding model limits single input length (e.g. ≤512 tokens). Consider reducing chunk size (e.g. 400–700) or switching to an embedding model with a longer context.
errorHints.providerCode: Provider error code: {{code}}. Check model availability, API key/quota, or test connection in Model Configuration.
errorHints.forbidden: 403 is usually an API key/quota/model-permission issue: verify provider key, model access, and rate limits.

guide.title: Guide
guide.scopeMe: You are configuring personal models: configure providers first, then set defaults for Chat/Embedding/Rerank.
guide.scopeTenant: You are configuring tenant shared models: configure providers first, then set defaults for Chat/Embedding/Rerank.

steps.configureProvider: Click “Configure API”: set API Base / API Key and enable the provider.
steps.setActiveModels: Edit “Active models”: choose default chat/embedding/rerank models for {{scope}}.
steps.modelKeyFallback: When model-level API key is empty, it will reuse provider-level API key (safer, fewer copies).
steps.localOpenAICompat: “Local (OpenAI-compatible)” requires an OpenAI-compatible /v1 endpoint; API key can be empty and Base can point to your service (it will auto-append /v1).

ui.customModelPlaceholder: Enter model name, e.g. gpt-4-turbo, claude-3-5-sonnet
ui.customModelHelper: Enter the model name you want to use
ui.customModelHelperNotInList: Custom model name (not in the predefined list)

apiKeyHints.modelKeyMasked: Saved model-level API key; leave empty to keep, or enter a new key
apiKeyHints.useProviderKeyOrOverride: Leave empty to use provider API key, or enter a model-level key to override
apiKeyHints.maskedKeepOrReplace: Saved API key; leave empty to keep, or enter a new key
apiKeyHints.enterValid: Please enter a valid API key

apiKeyPlaceholders.keepMasked: Leave empty to keep existing API key
apiKeyPlaceholders.useProviderKey: Leave empty to use provider key

ui.apiBaseHint: Leave empty to use default endpoint

providerApiKeyHints.localOptional: Local/OpenAI-compatible endpoint may not require a key
providerApiKeyHints.enterValid: Please enter a valid API key

providerApiKeyPlaceholders.keep: Leave empty to keep existing API key

description.title: Configuration Instructions
description.subtitle: Please configure your model API keys and parameters. The system supports the following three model providers:

providers.deepseek: DeepSeek: Excellent code generation and chat models
providers.qwen: Qwen: Alibaba Cloud's comprehensive large language model
providers.siliconflow: SiliconFlow: API services providing various open-source models

presets.title: Quick Configuration Presets
presets.description: Choose a preset configuration to get started quickly. You still need to fill in the corresponding API Keys

recommendations.title: Usage Recommendations
recommendations.economy: Economic Configuration: Use DeepSeek for chat, SiliconFlow for embedding and reranking
recommendations.premium: Premium Configuration: Use Qwen's premium models for all services
recommendations.chinese: Chinese Optimized: Use Qwen chat model with SiliconFlow's Chinese embedding models

messages.loadError: Failed to load configuration, using default settings
messages.presetApplied: Preset configuration applied, please fill in the corresponding API Keys
messages.providerHasKeyHint: {{provider}} API key is configured; you can leave model API key empty to reuse it
messages.presetSelected: Selected preset: {{name}}. Please set API keys for each model.

sharedModels.title: Shared Models
sharedModels.description: When enabled, team admins can add members to a whitelist so they can fall back to team-shared model configuration when personal models are not configured.

login.title: Login
login.subtitle: Sign in to your account to continue using RAG Platform
login.loginError: Login failed, please check your username and password

register.title: Register
register.subtitle: Join RAG Platform and start your intelligent knowledge management journey
register.registerError: Registration failed, please try again later
register.fillAllFields: Please fill in all required fields

platform.title: Next-Generation Intelligent Knowledge Platform
platform.description: Based on advanced Retrieval Augmented Generation technology, providing intelligent knowledge management and Q&A solutions for your team

dialog.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete user '{username}'?

errors.enableFirst: Enable "Allow shared models" for this tenant first.
errors.updateFailed: Failed to update shared model settings

tooltips.teamDisabled: Disabled: tenant shared models not enabled
tooltips.crossTenantDisabled: Disabled: cross-tenant shared models not allowed

workflowTester.title: Workflow Test (Chat)
workflowTester.emptyHint: Enter a message and send. The system will execute the current workflow and return results.

schema.noStructured: No structured parameters inferred. You can run by entering text below.

inputErrors.missingAny: Please enter input or fill parameters before running

messages.doneNoResult: Execution completed but no result returned (may be interrupted or backend did not emit complete payload).

debug.label: Debug (include per-step input/output)
debug.retryTooltip: Retry from this node and downstream

branches.placeholderDescription: Branch placeholder node (replace with any node)

fields.name: Template name
fields.categoryHint: e.g. customer_service / document_processing / ai_assistant / data_analysis / custom

confirmTest.title: Enter Test
confirmTest.body: Unsaved changes detected. Entering test will use the last saved version, or you can save before entering.

apiDialog.title: Workflow API
apiDialog.desc: Use Public API for external calls (requires header x-api-key). Create API keys in Settings → API Keys.
apiDialog.crossTenantHint: Cross-tenant: the workflow must be public and the API key must bind allowed_workflow_id.
apiDialog.baseHint: Full URLs are derived from VITE_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL / VITE_BACKEND_URL or the browser address bar.

palette.title: Node Library
palette.hint: Tip: drag to canvas or click to add

llm.name: LLM
llm.description: Call a chat model to generate text

rag_retriever.name: RAG Retriever
rag_retriever.description: Retrieve relevant content from a knowledge base

http_request.name: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Send an HTTP request and return response_data/status_code

inspector.title: Inspector
inspector.noUpstreamWarning: No upstream connections: connect first, then come back to bind inputs.
inspector.lastRunHint: Run results are currently shown in the Test page (later we can show last input/output here).
inspector.noConfig: This node has no configurable parameters.
inspector.outputsHint: Downstream connections can select these output fields.
inspector.createBranchesHint: Connecting from the true/false handles auto-fills the edge condition and passes through data.

helpers.templateSupport: Template supported: {{variable}} (resolved via data/input/context at runtime).
helpers.conditionValue: Template supported: {{variable}} (can be empty for truthy).
helpers.maxStdoutChars: Limit stdout length; exceeded output will be truncated.
helpers.maxInputBytes: Limit input/context JSON size; exceeded size will error.
helpers.maxResultBytes: Limit result JSON size; exceeded size will error.
helpers.outputTemplate: Leave empty to output input_data directly (compatible with data wrapper).

validation.maxTokensPositive: max_tokens must be a positive integer
validation.llmNoUpstream: This LLM node has no upstream input; it may receive an empty prompt
validation.conditionValueEmpty: condition_value is empty (only optional for truthy)
validation.codeResultHint: Tip: set variable result as the output
validation.sandboxNoImport: Sandbox forbids import (use built-in json/re/math or pure logic)
validation.outputSelectOverridden: select_path is set, but template will override it when non-empty
validation.outputTemplateBlank: template contains only whitespace; output may be empty
validation.outputTemplateNotConfigured: No template configured: will output input_data directly
validation.timeoutPositive: timeout must be a positive number (seconds)
validation.headersMustBeObject: headers must be a JSON object
validation.paramsMustBeObject: params must be a JSON object
validation.overridesMustBeObject: overrides must be an object (key -> value)

templatePicker.autocompleteHint: Type {{ to autocomplete (↑↓ select, Enter confirm)

promptKey.hintConnected: Recommended: if you mapped fields via edges, choose from “From edges”; otherwise use “Runtime inputs”.
promptKey.hintDisconnected: Tip: without upstream connections use “Runtime inputs”; after connecting, “From edges” will appear.

io.inputsHint: These are input fields this node can accept; choose target_input on edges.
io.outputsHint: These are possible output fields; choose source_output on edges.
io.outgoingHint: Shows where each output is connected (source_output / target_input per edge).

bindings.llmHint: After connecting upstream, choose which source output maps to which LLM input field. This edits edge mapping (same as editing edge properties).
bindings.ragHint: RAG reads query first, then prompt/text/input. Map upstream output to query.
bindings.outputHint: Output node formats input into result. Common pattern: map LLM content to Output data.
bindings.connectUpstreamFirst: Connect upstream nodes first (then you can choose input sources/mappings here).

quickFill.ragToLlmSystemPrompt:
Answer the user's question based on the following materials; if insufficient, say you cannot be sure.

Materials: {{documents}}

variableHints.title: Variable hints (runtime {{runtime}} / edges {{edges}})
variableHints.hintAutocomplete: In template fields, typing {{ triggers autocomplete; you can also click to copy/insert below.

sections.runtimeInput: Runtime inputs (from test/execution input, not dependent on edges):
sections.runtimeContext: Runtime context (tenant/user, not dependent on edges):
sections.fromEdges: From edges (available after connecting upstream; will be included in this node's input_data):

codeExecutor.convention: Convention: set variable result as output (e.g. result = {"content": "..."}).

branches.hint: Branch hint: connecting from the true/false handles auto-fills edge condition and passes through data.

output.priorityHint: Priority: if template is set, template wins; otherwise select_path reads from input (e.g. data.content).
output.templateHint: Templates support {{variable}} (recommended) or Python format {content} (legacy; used when template does not contain {{).

ioPreview.title: IO preview
ioPreview.hint: Shows this node's input/output fields. Actual mapping is configured in “Edges / IO”.

advanced.overridesHint: Use overrides to fill input fields when there is no upstream edge (e.g. set prompt for LLM). Supports {{variable}}.

edgeInspector.title: Edge
edgeInspector.emptyHint: Select an edge to edit mapping/condition/transform.
edgeInspector.sourceOutputHint: Source output field/handle (prefer dropdown; you can override below when needed).
edgeInspector.targetInputHint: Target input field/handle (e.g. LLM prefers input/prompt; Output prefers data).

helpers.condition: Condition expression (safe eval, no function calls). Vars: value/input/context. Example: value["condition_result"] == True
helpers.transform: Transform expression (executed by backend). Example: {"query": value["content"]}

list.title: Executions
list.hint: Only executions you have access to are shown.

detail.title: Execution Detail
detail.selectHint: Select an execution to view steps.

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.crossTenantHint: For cross-tenant public workflows, bind allowed_workflow_id on the key.

createDialog.title: Create API Key
createDialog.name: Name
createDialog.allowedWorkflowHelp: Bind to a workflow_id for cross-tenant public workflow runs.

confirm.leaveOwner: As the team owner, leaving will delete the entire team. Continue?

empty.title: You haven't joined any team yet
empty.subtitle: Create a new team or join an existing team with an invite code.

fields.messagePlaceholder: Optional: tell the invitee why you are inviting them...

join.title: Join team
join.hint: Joining a new team will automatically leave the current team (if any).

permissionDisplay.superAdminHint: Super admin has all system permissions, including permissions not listed above.

fields.name: Tenant name
fields.slugHelp: Used in URL; letters, numbers, and hyphens only.

delete.title: Confirm delete
delete.body: Delete tenant "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

testPage.title: Diagnostics

fields.testKnowledgeBaseNameHint: Only letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens.

testPage.sampleKnowledgeBaseDescription: A knowledge base created for quick verification.

help.title: Parameter help
help.description: These parameters affect only your account. If model list is empty, configure providers in Settings → Model Configuration first.

items.extraction: Default model used for semantic candidate extraction.
items.embedding: Used for document vectorization and retrieval.
items.rerank: Reranks retrieval results (better relevance but more latency/cost).
items.chunk: Larger chunks preserve context but increase indexing cost.

fields.extractionModelHelp: Used for semantic extraction in the knowledge base.
fields.extractionDocumentLimitHelp: 1–50. Limits how many documents are scanned per run.
fields.extractionAutoChunkingHelp: Adjusts sampling size based on chunk count.
fields.extractionModeHelp: Choose direct extraction or summarize first.
fields.extractionProgressiveEnabledHelp: Expand chunks when results are sparse
fields.extractionEntityTypeWhitelistHelp: Comma or newline separated types to keep
fields.extractionRelationTypeWhitelistHelp: Comma or newline separated relation types
fields.chatSystemPromptPlaceholder: Optional instructions for all chat messages. Use {context} and {query} for RAG templates.
fields.chatSystemPromptHelp: Saved per user and used as a default. You can override it in the Chat page.

params.retrievalTopKHelp: Number of chunks returned per retrieval

header.title: Workflow Templates
header.subtitle: Discover curated workflow templates and build your AI app faster

empty.noMatch: No templates match your criteria. Try adjusting your search.

preview.visibilityFailed: Failed to update visibility (author or admin required)

messages.seedFailed: Failed to import sample templates (admin required)

demo.banner: Demo mode: showing sample data when backend APIs are unavailable.

customerService.name: Customer Service
customerService.description: Intent classification + RAG retrieval + LLM answer

customerService.name: Customer Service Agent
customerService.description: Handles user questions and retrieves knowledge

delete.title: Confirm delete
delete.confirm: Delete "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

modelConfigReminder.title: Model configuration required
modelConfigReminder.body: Your account has no usable chat model configuration, so LLM/RAG/workflow tests will fail.
modelConfigReminder.missingKey: A chat model is selected but API Key/Base URL is missing (or disabled). Please complete it in Settings → Model Configuration.
modelConfigReminder.missingConfig: Please select a chat model and save it in Settings → Model Configuration (remember API Key for providers that require it).
modelConfigReminder.tenantHint: If you want to use tenant-shared models, ask an admin to enable shared models and add you to the allowlist.
